main event: A civilian observed a bright white object in the sky over Lynchburg, Virginia on June 11, 1966 for about 6 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a light that could be compared to a satellite, with north-south motion characteristic of a satellite.
The object was traveling towards the southeast.
The observer could not accurately measure the angular size of the object.
The observer described the object as looking like a 'round star-shaped object' that was brighter than the North Star.
The observer said the object did not make any sound and did not disappear while being watched.
sighted object: A bright white object in the sky
